newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft Q1 cash, investments at $7.1 bln.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft Q1 cash, investments at $7.1 bln.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said cash and short-term investments totalled $7.1 billion in the quarter ended September 30, 1996.
This compared with $6.9 billion in the quarter ended June 30 and $5.1 billion in the year-ago first quarter ended September 30, 1995.
Microsoft reported first quarter net income of $614 million, and $0.95 per share, up 22 percent from the $0.78 reported for the corresponding quarter last year.
Microsoft cited strong momentum behind its version 4.0 of Windows NT(R).

"Corporate customers made the decision to adopt Windows NT Servers and Workstations in record numbers, driving 19 percent revenue growth over last quarter in the U.S. and Canada," said Jeff Raikes, group vice president, sales and marketing.
